s2.title: Release Information for &XercesCName; 3.1.1
s2.p: The following new features and bug fixes have been implemented in &XercesCName; 3.1.1:

tr.td: Check that we have non-NULL host before trying to connect (XERCESC-1920).
Recover from the mismatching start/end even count which may happen when we continue parsing an invalid document (XERCESC-1919).
Add Visual Studio 2010 projects and solution.
Use proper VC++ version in PDB file name.
If the transcoder doesn't process any input, throw an exception (XERCESC-1916).
Delay the recursive expansion of includes until the document fragment has been placed in the final location (XERCESC-1918).
The code formatting a content model was skipping the cardinality indicators (*, +, ?) (XERCESC-1914).
Fix a few bugs and memory leaks in XInclude code.
Give proper name to 64-bit PDB file in static build (XERCESC-1907).
Don't include cpuid.h if we are using intrin.h (XERCESC-1912).

Set scanner object on validation context. Needed during QName validation. Don't re-validate default/fixed values in preContentValidation when called from loadGrammar. This values are already validated in TraverseSchema.
Remove explicit setting of prefix for cloned elements and attributes since it is done properly by the create*() functions (XERCESC-1913).

s2.title: Release Information for &XercesCName; 3.1.0
s2.p: The following new features and bug fixes have been implemented in &XercesCName; 3.1.0:

tr.td: Remove the "experimental" marker from the loadGrammar API.
Fix an infinite loop bug in XML 1.1 NCName parsing.
Get rid of warnings uncovered with g++ -W -Wall.
Don't call u_init in ICU 3.6 and later.
Store the anonymous type count in the SchemaGrammar object.
Save the scope count to the grammar object in case we will be adding to this schema (multi-import case).
Mark schema DOM representation as unavailable after the call to TraverseSchema.
Don't use intrinsics in VS.NET 2003 since they are not available.
Redo libcurl check to avoid liking to the library when we don't use it. Also update the make pretty-printing code.
Fix a bug in the new LocalFileFormatTarget buffering implementation.
Clear the cached GrammarInfo list when calling resedCachedGrammarPool.
Limit the buffer growth in LocalFileFormatTarget to 64Kb. Optimize MemBufFormatTarget.

Make sure that imported schemas, as well as those loaded with loadGrammar or via the schemaLocation attributes get taken into account when we decide whether the schema in question has already been loaded.
Implement loading of multiple schemas with the same namespace in loadGrammar() when multi-import is enabled.
Extend multi-import support to schemas provided with the schemaLocation attributes (XERCESC-1659).
Try to switch to the XML Schema mode if we see xsi:type or xsi:nill (XERCESC-1263).
Provide a more descriptive error message for empty date-time type values (XERCESC-1703).
Skip the character that we just unescaped when searching for the next percent sign (XERCESC-1826).
Recognize a register-based authority in URI (XERCESC-1748, XERCESC-1747).
Commit a partial fix for XERCESC-1866 by David Bertoni.
Load schemas specified with the external schema location properties even if the load-schema property is set to false (XERCESC-1713).
Catch and ignore exceptions in destructors (XERCESC-1898).
Fixed DOMDocumentImpl::importNode() to copy the prefix of element and attribute nodes.
Add a variant to test for XERCESC-1893.
Call getDatatypeValidator before checking whether the schema has been imported.
Rework the way we search for and detect the ICU and libcurl libraries (XERCESC-1892).
Rework the binToText implementation and usage so that we don't need the XERCES_SIZEOF_* macros. This should allow using the same set of headers for 32 and 64-bit builds (XERCESC-1874).
Fix ICU message loader makefile to handle dist properly.
As we now generate source files for the ICU message loader, use standard automake code.
Rework compilation of ICU message loader resources (XERCESC-1882).
Do not complain that the XSD namespace is not imported (XERCESC-1896).
Enable multiple import handling in examples and test.
Allow the user to change the low water mark used by the parsers (XERCESC-1607).
Free resources if we throw from c-tors (XERCESC-1480).
Disable throwing of an exception from the DOMLSParser::parse*() functions (XERCESC-1894).
Export PDB also for static builds (XERCESC-1759).
When the base type for a complex type cannot be found in an imported schema that has already been processed, check if a simple type with the same name exists (XERCESC-1893).
Check if glibtoolize exist. Otherwise call libtoolize.
For builds with curl, use curl-config to get appropriate compiler and linker flags (XERCESC-1892).
Place the creation of token in the main function to avoid misalignments.
When releasing an element, remove and release also its attributes (XERCESC-646).

Improve support for DOMLSParserFilter: (1) if startElement() returned REJECT it was treated like SKIP, and it was changing the current parent node one time too much; (2) the acceptNode() callback was invoked on text nodes every time some data was added to them, potentially removing it many times; (3) the nodes rejected by the callback were not recycled, leading to the same memory footprint as they were accepted.

The test to detect if the CPU was SSE2-enabled using __get_cpuid was reversed; configure.ac was testing for the presence of emmintrin.h before detecting which compiler option turned on SSE2, and the header cannot be used until that switch has been set.
If a minOccurs/maxOccurs cannot be parsed in a valid integer because it's too big, assume it is 500.
Use SSE2 instructions to speed up bit operations used in schema validation with large maxOccurs.
The invalid xs:float is now e-46, not e-39.
Updated documentation to reflect the change in limits for xs:float datatype.
Fixed memory leak; added optimization to the bitfield enumerator.

Improved performance and reduced memory footprint of schema validation involving large maxOccurs: (1) the CMStateSet uses a sparsely allocated matrix to store the bits, resulting in less memory usage and faster bitwise operations (when analyzing an unallocated chunk, no operations are done); also, having moved the dynamic buffer data members into a separate structure, the space used by two pointers has been added to the cached bit fields, that is now 128 bits; (2) the DFA builder chooses the faster algorithm depending on the data being analyzed. The regression test for XERCESC-1051 now completes in 30 seconds instead of 80.
When testing for simple type blocked substitutions, allow list and unions when base type is anySimpleType.
When testing for blocked substitutions, check the entire inheritance chain.
Added optimizations forgotten in previous commit, plus tests.
When retrieving an attribute of a schema declaration, specify its type so that the proper whitespace collapse operation can be performed.
Move the list with the imported targetNamespace in TraverseSchema, so that a schema can "see" what an imported schema imports (XERCESC-1249).
When matching an XPath expression, don't accept a node only if it's the first branch of an union that matches. The XPath parser takes care of removing identical branches (XERCESC-809).
Ignore the lax directive if an element has an xsi:type directive (XERCESC-1707).
When storing a default/fixed value, use the canonical representation.
Use an entity resolver to feed the grammar for the XML namespace.
When building the key for identity constraints, use the topmost validator.
Name and reference to names should be whitespace collapsed.
Don't manipulate the XPath expression to ensure it starts with "./" before parsing; add the proper token after the scanner phase.
Complain if an identity constraint has an empty name.
When placing a value in the identity constraint map, store the actual validator used, instead of the official one.
Instead of using the FLT_MIN and FLT_MAX macros, use the XMLSchema definition of minimum and maximum value for a xs:float (XERCESC-1833).
When the xsi:type attribute is present, don't emit validation errors complaining of a missing declaration (XERCESC-1481).
Attributes in the xsi namespace were not whitespace-normalized.

Blocked substitution was not checked when defined on a complex type (XERCESC-1568): (1) Blocked substitution should not be checked when xsi:type names the same original type; (2) Blocked substitution didn't check the bit of the restriction/extension, but it performed an equality check.
When parsing a "block" attribute, an empty value means an empty set, not "use blockDefault".
When parsing a "final" attribute, an empty value means an empty set, not "use finalDefault" (XERCESC-1716).
When an identity constraint involves a QName, store the value using its Clark name so that values using different prefixes can be matched.
When validating an annotation, report the location of the error in the source schema, not inside the annotation itself.
Test that runs a few parse operations with an input stream that splits the source in bad locations.
Before assuming that a complex type has a simple type as base type simply because it has a data type validator, inspect the base type definition (XERCESC-697).
Before processing a schema location, remove the 0xFFFF characters present in the non-normalized attribute value (XERCESC-1831).
If a derived attribute is prohibited, don't check type substitution and fixed facet (XERCESC-961).
Deprecate two symbols because of a typo in the name; added a version with the correct spelling.
Don't report repetitions in the block/final schema attributes as errors. If a derived attribute is prohibited, don't check type substitution and fixed facet (XERCESC-961).
On Linux, iconv requires char*; on Solaris, const char*. Use autoconf to pick the correct code.
Allow GNUiconv to be compiled on Solaris (XERCESC-1856).
Allow platform with machine/endian.h to select the GNUiconv transcoder.
Add an autoconf test to verify if the compiler supports the matching operator delete (XERCESC-1380).
Before complaining that there are not enough child nodes, test the existing ones to be correct (XERCESC-1246).
Fix end position for fixed string pattern matching (XERCESC-1021).
Report an error if more than one anyAttribute declaration is found, or if it is not the last declaration (XERCESC-1717).
If an imported schema had a keyref definition, all the others keyref definition ended up in that schema, and would not be enforced (XERCESC-1583).
If there is no complex type in the stack, fallback to the schema element definition, like it is done a few lines earlier (XERCESC-1808).

When copying a context object, allocate new memory for fMatch and fOffsets only if the size of the data being copied is different, so that a user-provided fMatch object can be properly filled (XERCESC-1870).
Improve scalability of identity checking by using a hash table whose hash value is computed on the canonical values of the values (XERCESC-1878).
Added methods defined in the Element Traversal specification (http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-ElementTraversal-20081222/).
Include system-dependent files only if the appropriate macro is defined (XERCESC-1852).

Avoid recursion when parsing simply nested DTD structures. This issue is referenced in the following document: CVE-2009-1885 (http://nvd.nist.gov/nvd.cfm?cvename=CVE-2009-1885). Thanks to Jukka Taimisto, Tero Rontti and Rauli Kaksonen from the CROSS project at Codenomicon Ltd. and CERT-FI for bringing this issue to our attention.
Improve XSTSHarness to also run the XML Test Suite.
Add quotes around path in custom build command (XERCESC-1868).
The PDB file for VC 9.0 used "vc80" (XERCESC-1869).
Check return value of getaddrinfo for non-zero instead of less-than-zero (XERCESC-1871).
The implementation of some methods didn't match exactly the signature (XERCESC-1867).
Save the scope count value in the SchemaGrammar object. This is necessary for the multiple import option to function correctly.
Initializing unitialized variables in TranscodeToStr and TranscodeFromStr (#XERCESC-1858).
Fixed a bug when transcoding small strings using TranscodeToStr (XERCESC-1858).
When the DOMLSInput contains a stringData buffer, the encoding of the source is XMLCh.

s2.title: Release Information for &XercesCName; 3.0.1
s2.p: The following bugs have been fixed in &XercesCName; 3.0.1:

tr.td: More robust handling of leading/trailing whitespaces (XERCESC-1838).
Minor documentation updates, including a fix for XERCESC-1848.
Remove class name from method declaration (XERCESC-1850).
Fix a bug in the socket and winsock net accessors when a redirection response does not contain a "Location" header.
Make XMLMutex use the correct MemoryManager when it closes it's mutex.
Force Borland projects to use CRLF EOL.
The wrong constructor was called, causing a memory leak (XERCESC-1840).
Update URLs in source code to point to the new pages.

s2.title: Release Information for &XercesCName; 3.0.0
s2.p: The following new features and bug fixes have been implemented in &XercesCName; 3.0.0:

tr.td: Create Borland project for NetAccessor test.
Allow use of the Windows transcoder and net accessor on Cygwin but only if the user explicitly asks for it.
Avoid DOMDocument definition from Windows SDK (XERCESC-1830).
Pass raw names to start/endElement if namespaces are disabled. Patch by David Bertoni.
Reimplement skippedString logic to handle "short" and "long" strings separately.
Temporary fix for XERCESC-1827 along with sanity test case.
Avoid pretty-printing comments only in text-only nodes.
Do not add any whitespaces around CDATA sections and comments since they might be non-ignorable (XERCESC-1823).
Add support for generating pkgconfig file. Patch by Jay Berkenbilt (XERCESC-1824).
Pass proper memory manager to mutex.
Allow changing global DOMDocument heap parameters via overloaded Initialize().
Include winnt.h from the Platform SDK instead of winres.h from MFC.

Remove the PCRE-like regular expression engine, and replace it with a XPath 2.0-compatible one (XERCESC-1816). Original patch by John Snelson, modified to fix an exception thrown when expressions negating a character class (e.g. [^\s]) were used.

Remove repetitive calls to the getOwnerDocument() virtual function and in some cases use the data member directly. Put DOMStringPool functionality directly into DOMDocumentImpl, make getPooledString() inline.
Get rid of unused MemoryManager argument in hash functions.
Fixed regression in determining lax/skip/strict processing of an xsd:any preceded by another xsd:any represented using compact syntax (XERCESC-1822).
The XSTS schema allows multiple schema files to be loaded before a test.
When comparing two unions, use the validator that correctly parses both instances.

If an element cannot be found in the schema for its namespace, it is also searched in the empty namespace to see if the user mistakenly forgot about undefining the default namespace; in this case a better error report is generated and (if schema processing is allowed to continue) the empty namespace definition is taken. However, even if the empty namespace definition didn't pass a few checks, we ended up silently using it -> we changed the namespace of the element without notifying the user (XERCESC-1819).

Build a compact tree also for xsd:any nodes (XERCESC-1051). Reduce the memory required to build a DFA by creating a shallow CMNode hierarchy. Avoid stack overflow when analyzing non-compact model trees. Optimized the building of the DFA state table by avoiding linear searches.
Cygwin is a POSIX emulation layer so use POSIX file manager, transcoder, path delimiter, and net accessor. Still using Windows mutex manager because of the problem in Cygwin pthread emulation.
Require the exact match for the schema loader and storer version.
More cleanup for unsigned int/XMLSize_t changes and various compiler warnings.

Backported fix for XERCESJ-773: build a representation of large minOccurs/maxOccurs in constant time and memory (which uses a counter during validation) for element and wildcard particles when each model group particle in the content model: has minOccurs/maxOccurs == 1 or contains only one element/wildcard particle with minOccurs/maxOccurs == 1. (XERCESC-1051).
Use mutex to synchronize access to global document. Fixes XERCESC-1652.
Disable automatic selection of ICU message loader when ICU is available (XERCESC-1769).
Review, cleanup and make consistent all error messages.
Use the ISO8859-1 encoding in net accessors. Add support for httpInfo in the curl net accessor. Patch by John Snelson (XERCESC-1805).
Added more checks to the XSD syntax.
Increment XERCES_GRAMMAR_SERIALIZATION_LEVEL since the size of line/column fields has changed.
Cleanup interfaces in parsers/ to use XMLSize_t.
Cleanup public interfaces in framework/ to use XMLSize_t.
Use the _wcsupr naming instead of wcsupr (only Visual C++ defines both, Borland only defines the version prefixed by the underscore).
Use XMLFileLoc consistently to represent line/column. Clean up the SAX interface to use XMLSize_t instead of int/long.
Add XMLFileLoc type (64-bit) that represents location in a file (line/column). Use it in DOM interfaces.
Added missing "Is" in front of the "MusicalSymbols" regex group.
Use XMLSize_t instead of int/long for indexes and sizes in DOM interfaces. Use enum types instead of short.
Define regular expression category \w as defined by the XMLSchema specs (XERCESC-541).
Provide a way to disable automatic loading of schemas specified in XML documents. Patch by Wouter Coene.
Move XMLGrammarPoolImpl from internal/ to framework/ so that it can be instantiated directly by the use.
XSTSHarness now handles the 2006 version of the test suite.
Implement the revised interpretation of ##other in which unqualified names are not matched. Fixes XERCESC-1758, XERCESC-1655.

Add getContentType function to the BinInputStream to allow stream to report out-of-band content type. Implement it in various streams. Factor out and cleanup common code from Socket and WinSock net accessors. Fix a number of bugs. Patch by John Snelson (XERCESC-1805).

Change the DOMXPathResult interface to accommodate both XPath 1 and 2 models. Return DOMXPathResult* instead of void* from evaluate. Add basic auto pointer operations to JanitorMemFunCall class template.
Make regular expressions thread-safe and use runtime memory manager when executing. Add new allMatches() function for advanced use-cases. Patch by John Snelson (XERCESC-1803).
DOM XPath support: Support for resolving default namespace. Support for removing namespace-prefix bindings. Additional documentation.
Avoid that an external entity having an empty SYSTEM id is treated as internal (XERCESC-1763).
Schema fixes for e1-16 errata and full schema checking of any choice restricted by any.
Add addNamespaceBinding() and release() APIs to XPathNSResolver class (XERCESC-1802) - patch by John Snelson.
Don't blindly subtract a number from an unsigned int, it could overflow (XERCESC-1804).
Rewrite the storage mechanism to avoid cast (XERCESC-1678).
Avoid error messages where English words are specified at runtime.
Replace copyrighted schema with a simple test case (XERCESC-1791).
Fix XERCESC-1790. Other error messages cleanups.
DOMPrint now shows how to run an XPath query on a DOM tree (XERCESC-1786).
If the XPath parser returns 'false', it means the XPath is invalid. (XERCESC-1787).
Identity constraints on xs:anySimpleType instances are enforced by comparing their lexical values (XERCESC-1393).
Lock the mutex when performing cleanup in the WinSock net accessor.
When looking for the best encoding, match both char size and endianness.
Add UTF16-LE and UTF16-BE to the list of encodings tested by GNUiconv (XERCESC-1663).
Get rid of lazy initialization that relied on double-checked locking. Now every static object is initialized in Initialize() and released in Terminate() via XMLInitializer.
New RPM spec by Scott Cantor.
Apply the fast DOM child append patch (XERCESC-1735).
Adjust DOM heap allocation parameters to be the same as in 2.8.0 which appears to give the best overall performance.
Add VC9 target, remove references to deprecated DOM.
Validate the attributes of a simple type definition before trusting its content (XERCESC-1718).
Report an error when a grammar or a type is not found (XERCESC-1745).
Added configuration to VC9 project files to build Xerces with the ICU transcoder.
Added configuration to VC8 project files to build Xerces with the ICU transcoder.
Added configuration to VC7.1 project files to build Xerces with the ICU transcoder.
Check for the callback pointer to be valid before each call, as a callback could be resetting it (XERCESC-1781).
Make sure the base type was provided when trying to resolve the schema grammar (addition to the previous fix) (XERCESC-1777).
In restriction checking, when looking for a declaration of a base element, use the schema grammar corresponding to the type this element is declared in (XERCESC-1777).
Update gMaxProtoLen to reflect the addition of "https" (XERCESC-1698).
Use the same code as in the fopen.c sample from libcurl (XERCESC-1756).
Show how to release a transcoded string (XERCESC-1767).
Add project files for Visual Studio 2008.
Encode characters for anyURI using xlink 5.4 algorithm. Patch from Gilbert Chan.
- Don't allocate a stack unless the string to be matched is longer than 256 characters. Don't use backtracking if the regex pattern doesn't have ambiguities (XERCESC-1242).
- SrcOffset is a XMLFilePos (64 bit). MsgLoader and Transcode API needed some more XMLSize_t (XERCESC-1531).
Avoid recursion when checking for closures. Patch by Vitaly Prapirny (XERCESC-1242).
The GroupContentRestricted error is used for both 'sequence' and 'choice' models, so get the model at runtime (XERCESC-1724).
Parser interfaces now use XMLSize_t for characters, comment, ignorableWhitespace, docCharacters, doctypeWhitespace (XERCESC-1531).
Send the NODE_CLONED notification for each node in the tree when cloning the entire DOMDocument (XERCESC-1722).
GNUIconv should not look at APP_NO_THREADS, and look at where endian.h is located (XERCESC-1709).
Line numbers should use unsigned long (XERCESC-1531).
XMLString, XMLBuffer and Base64 should use XMLSize_t (XERCESC-1531).
All lists and vectors should use unsigned int to report size and access items (XERCESC-1531).
Changed XMLFormatTarget interface to have writeChars use XMLSize_t (XERCESC-1531).
Changed XMLTransService interface to have transcodeFrom and transcodeTo use XMLSize_t (XERCESC-1531).
Changed BinOutputStream interface to have curPos return a 64-bit integer, and use XMLSize_t in writeBytes (XERCESC-1531).
Changed BinInputStream interface to have curPos return a 64-bit integer, and use XMLSize_t in readBytes (XERCESC-1531).
Apply base whitespace facet to enumeration values. Patch from Gilbert Chan.
Suppress DTD error message for attribute referring to unknown entity when attribute not used. Patch from John Kim.
In the fix for XERCESC-1592, code to set xmlns="" that was moved from retrieveNamespaceMappping to preprocessSchema was not executed for imported schemas.
mblen returns 0 when given an empty string; rewrote code to only use mbstowcs (XERCESC-1702).
Add https to the list of valid protocols for XMLURL (XERCESC-1698).
Add x64 target to VC8 project files.
Make the header guards less obvious (XERCESC-1693).
Fixed infinite loop when an XPath expression contained an unexpected character (XERCESC-1682).
IconvGNU and IconvFBSD transcoders override application-set locale, XERCESC-1660 (patch by Boris Kolpackov).
Initial commit of XInclude support (by Simon Rowland).

Even if the XSTS suite thinks differently, the XMLSchema 1.1 clarifies that two values derived from the same value space should be treated as equals; so find out the common ancestor and use it to perform the comparison.

Implemented the DOML3 XPath interfaces, reusing the XPath processor used inside the XMLSchema validation; this means it understands only a limited subset of the XPath syntax, and can only return DOMElement nodes. However, it could be useful for simple navigations, or maybe be later expanded.
Allow 'list' and 'union' in the finalDefault attribute of a schema (XERCESC-1633).
Only xs:key should complain if not all the fields of an identity constraint are not found in the XML instance (XERCESC-1237).
When calling getAttributeNodeNS, ensure we are providing a localName (XERCESC-1473).
The 'dst' argument in the DOMUserDataHandler::handle callback is non-const, in order to let the application modify the newly created node (XERCESC-783).
Performance improvement: allocate memory only when the data inside the XMLElementDecl cannot be reused.
Use the algorithm from http://unicode.org/unicode/faq/utf_bom.html#35 to encode/decode surrogate pairs (XERCESC-1654).
Enable IPv6 addresses by using getaddrinfo when available [based on a patch by Ramanjaneyulu Malisetti].
Handle both IPv4 and IPv6 on Windows (to be enabled via a macro, as it is only available starting with Windows XP) [based on a patch by Ramanjaneyulu Malisetti].
Report the correct error when the XML PI has 'XML' instead of 'xml' (XERCESC-1641).
Allow the user to specify the memory manager used by LSSerializer::writeToString.
When checking for a valid restriction, take into account substitution groups (XERCESC-1281).
Don't crash if an external parameter entity has no SYSTEM id (XERCESC-1536).
IconvGNU transcoder now works on big endian machines.
Default or fixed attribute values should be whitespace normalized, if the datatype requires it, before being validated.
DOMLSParserImpl::loadGrammar should not release the previously loaded DOMDocument (XERCESC-1626).
Reduce the number of allocations needed by text and attribute nodes (XERCESC-1585).
Remove support for building Xerces with VC7.
Removed usage of MB_CUR_MAX from iconv transcoder; if the block-oriented APIs are available, use them (XERCESC-1444, patch by Axel Weiss).
Added parameter space-first-level-elements to DOMLSSerializer to let the user control whether the children of the document root should have an extra line feed between them (XERCESC- 1561).
SAX2XMLReader should use the prefix reported by the reader, not the one stored in the element declaration (XERCESC-1598).
DGXMLScanner was treating predefined entities inside attribute values as if they were in the element content (XERCESC-1597).
Allow spaces in anyURIs, as they are 'legal but highly discouraged' (XERCESC-1581).
Factory method is no more inline to avoid including an internal header in a public one (XERCESC-1579).
Remove BOM-detection code inside refreshCharBuffer: the fix for XERCESC-1284 makes it unnecessary, and the UTF-8 part was updating the wrong index (XERCESC-1385).
When serializing attribute values, escape also carriage returns and tabs (XERCESC-1547).
If an encoding has been forced on a InputSource, ignore a compatible BOM found in the stream (XERCESC-1284).
Patch from Tobias Schuette for XERCESC-1491.
Fix for XERCESC-1555 from Mark Weaver.
Fix for XERCESC-1546. Canonical value of list was putting in an extra null character.
When evaluating a union in a regular expression, take the branch that matches the longest part of the input string (XERCESC-1521).
Improve validation performances when dealing with schemas with lots of top level definitions (XERCESC-1542).
Fix for XERCESC-1533 (default attributes in the definition for an element that is not validated because of errors would be added to the list of attributes even if already present).

Expose the memory allocation functionalities of DOMDocumentImpl through the DOMMemoryManager interface; this removes dangerous casts in the operator new and allows to tune the size of the memory chunks (XERCESC-1475).
When cloning or importing a node, also copy the type information (XERCESC- 1517).
Nodes that implement getFeature should also implement isSupported (XERCESC-1479).
Message update for qname fix and XERCESC-1515.
Schema errata e2-67 fix, ported from java to allow [^+-].
Remove references to nonexist DOMSystemException. XERCESC-1400.
Documentation for Base64::decode now state how whitespace is treated (XERCESC-974).
Close the socket even in case of exceptions being thrown (XERCESC-1467).
Added comment to state the namespace info wont work with this parser. XERCESC-1377.
Follow-up fix to XERCESC-990. Allow lookup for imported schema with no namespace.
Schema errata E2-27: don't have negative sign in front of zero.
Reset the flag used to signal a trailing space if the chunk doesn't end with a space (XERCESC-1239).
After looking for the DOM element defining the required type we should use the registry to perform the lookup instead of assuming the one we just parsed is the right one (XERCESC-990).
Fix problem where incorrect xsmodel was generated for UseCachedGrammarInParse.
Fix various schema date time problems.
Update XMLDateTime to correctly test for timezone.
Empty content for Base64Binary & HexBinary should be allowed.
Schema errata E2-67: allow unescaped '-' at the beginning and end of a regex.
Add const qualifier to getDocumentLocations to match interface (patch to 191040 for bug XERCESC-1153).
Resolve bug XERCESC-1436. Header and implementation of OpFactory used inconsistent function signature. Thanks to Axel Weiss.
Fix for XERCESC-1115. Allow zero length content.
Don't treat characters 0x2028 and 0x85 as plain characters in XML 1.1.
Schema errata update. Ignore length, minLength and maxLength facets for qname and notation.

IconvGNU and IconvFBSD transcoders override application-set locale (XERCESC-1660).

Complex type restriction with substation group fix.

DOMLSParserImpl::loadGrammar should not release the previously loaded DOMDocument (XERCESC-1626).

SAX2XMLReader should use the prefix reported by the reader, not the one stored in the element declaration (XERCESC-1598)
DGXMLScanner was treating predefined entities inside attribute values as if they were in the element content (XERCESC-1597)
Documentation update. Default validation is never, not auto.
Better message for invalid boolean datatype.
Performance fix, don't use QName as colon location is already available.
Use ln -fs instead of ln -f to avoid error message during Unix build.
Fix an error that manifested itself when a DTD defined a general entity using a parameter entity for specifying the name.
setEncoding was relying on XMLRecognizer::encodingForName to return OtherEncoding when presented with a endian-neutral UTF16/UTF32 encoding, but it doesn't do it anymore.

Ensure decimal is valid on getActualValue call when toValidate is true.

Allow whitespace at the beginning and after the union operator in XPath expressions of identity constraints.

Allow non-standard names for the C++ compiler.
Remove BOM-detection code inside refreshCharBuffer: the fix for XERCESC-1284 makes it unnecessary, and the UTF-8 part was updating the wrong index (XERCESC-1385).
When serializing attribute values, escape also carriage returns and tabs (XERCESC-1547).
If an encoding has been forced on a InputSource, ignore a compatible BOM found in the stream (XERCESC-1284).
Put annotations for duplicate elements on the first element.
Update schema limitations and clarify float and double behaviour.
Do not generate error message if switchGrammar fails when laxly validating.
Fix for XERCESC-1546. Canonical value of list was putting in an extra null character.
When evaluating a union in a regular expression, take the branch that matches the longest part of the input string (XERCESC-1521).
Fix for erroneous duplicate id problem.
Put debug code under specific flag so it only gets built when needed instead of for each debug build.
Schema fixes for union of union and empty element.
Improve validation performances when dealing with schemas with lots of top level definitions (XERCESC-1542).
Fix for XERCESC-1533 (default attributes in the definition for an element that is not validated because of errors would be added to the list of attributes even if already present).
When cloning or importing a node, also copy the type information (XERCESC-1517).
Treat "+" and "-" as invalid numeric schema values.
Fix bug where very long element names gives parsing error.
Generated static library in lowercase like the dynamic one (XERCESC-1522).
Nodes that implement getFeature should also implement isSupported (XERCESC- 1479).
Message update for QName fix and XERCESC-1515.
QName fix. Need to verify that the prefix is defined.
Check for valid schema characters for float and double.

Undefined symbol error when building a single threaded version of the xerces lib on irix.

Let users add their encoding to the intrinsic mapping table.
const should be used instead of static const. And other clean up bug fixes.

Guard the use of '-ptr${OUTDIR}' in EnumVal/Makefile.in

FAQ spell check, fix typos, fix grammar, readability editing, clean up formatting, re-organize so related topics appear together.

Access violations and stack overflows in insertBefore.

Add the new header LexicalHandler.hpp to Makefile.in.
removes '-instances=static' from the Linux link sections.

Add RangeTest as part of the xerces-all MSVC++ workspace.
Entity Reference cleanup dumping core if the last entity reference is deleted.
further fixes to Range, and update RangeTest.cpp with more test coverage.
Spell check, fix typos, fix grammar, readability editing, clean up formatting.
Remove dead code (old StdOut and StdErr functions); minor clean-up.
patch to fix a number of Range problems. See mail of 11/21/2000.
DOM_Text::splitText(), fix off by one error in the test for index too big error.
reuseValidator - fix bugs (spurious errors) that occurred on reuse due to pools already containing some items.
Bug fix for DTD entity reference problem reported by Tony Wuebben on 10/25.
config.guess and config.sub updated to newer versions.
Change InterlockedCompareExchange for compatibility with Borland BCB5
Fix incorrect version number in gXercesMinVersion.

Change XMLCh back to unsigned short on all platforms
COM: interpret BSTR as UTF-16 in documents
Solaris: change detection for native support for type bool to defined(_BOOL).
MXLString::trim() bug fix: failure to null terminate result.

From Janitor, remove the addition that is having compile problems in MSVC.

Autosense.hpp: modify sensing of Mac OS X.

DOM_Document - remove the un-implemented function putIdentifier() from the header.

DOMPrint sample: add deletes before exit so boundschecker runs cleanly.

Alpha processor support update in config.sub.

XMLReader::skippedString(), failed under certain rare circumstances.

Borland updates. It had fallen way behind.

Fix ICU transcoding service, crashing bug on Linux, Solaris

SAX2 DefaultHandler, inconsistency in const parameters fixed.

- attrs param of ContentHandler::startDocument() made const
- SAXExceptions thrown now have msgs

[ eg: getContentHander() ]

bug fix in removeAll() to zero out all the pointers.
Addition of NetAccessor functionality for MacOS, built on URLAccess library.
ICU Transcoding service: changes for move to ICU 1.6

allow nesting of PlatformUtils::Init() and Terminate()
ICU transcoding: fix off by one error.
Win32TransService - fix error in use of hashtables

XMLScaner.cpp bugfix: call startDocument() at beginning of scan.

fix for uninitialized variable gotData bug in XMLScanner.cpp.

Fixed bug in XMLString::trim(), reported by Michele Laghi

Fixed incorrect error check for end of file in Win32 platform utils.
DOMPrint enhancements. Add options for specifying character encoding of the output, better control over escaping of characters, better handling of CDATA sections. Default validation is now "auto"
XMLFormatter now escapes characters, as reqd., occurring midway in strings. Reported by Hugo Duncan.
Bug fix in implementation of DOM_Document::GetElementById()
Documentation, DTD for source xml files moved into xerces-c project, sbk: prefixes removed, xml can now be validated locally.

Fixed 'fatal error' when 'reusing the validator' problem reported
by Rocky Raccoon (rrockey@bigfoot.com). Fix submitted by
Dean Roddey (droddey@charmedquark.com).
DOMTest: removed incorrectly failing entity tests
Revised implementation of DOMDocument::getElementsById(), removed memory leaks, new test program for it.

Bug fix - A PE ref appearing at the start of a skipped conditional section
was incorrectly being processed rather than ignored. Fix from Dean Roddey.
Start using the socket based netaccessor by default on most Unix platforms.
Update ICUTransService to work with latest revision of ICU which provides a hard linked data DLL. i.e. icudata.dll will be loaded when xerces-c is loaded.
Problem with progressive parsing. parseNext() would through an exception when the document contains entities, either or external.

Add missing validity checks for stand-alone documents, character range
and Well-formed parsed entities.
Fix XMLReader defect reported by SHOGO SAWAKI
Fix problem with Windows filenames containing '\' in Japanese and Korean encodings.
Memory Cleanup. XMLPlatformUtils::Terminate() deletes all lazily allocated memory
Fixed defect in progressive parsing 'parseNext()' reported by Tim Johnston
Fixed Solaris build problems with static character constants. Tom Jordahl <tomj@allaire.com>
Reduced memory usage for DOM Attributes.
Memory leaks in TransService. Joseph Chen <JosephC@plumtree.com>
DOM - storage requirements for nodes substantially reduced.
Added DOM XMLDecl node type; provides access to XML declaration.
Added DOM access to DTD subset (DOM Level 2 feature)
API document generation changed to Doxygen from Doc++
Full support for DOM_EntityReference, DOM_Entity and DOM_DocumentType introduced
Don't allow spaces before PI target. Bug #42
Follow the SMP/E procedures for the OS/390 BATCH install
Auto-validate mode. Validate only when a DTD is present.

If a SAX error handler is installed, then the resetErrors() event handler
should call the one on the installed SAX error handler.
Allow an empty DOCTYPE declaration, with just the root name.
Add low level support for transcoding XML output to different character encodings.
Fixed hanging bug in character transcoding.
Enable installation of DTDHandler on SAX parser.
DOM: support for identifying "ignorable white space" text nodes.
Fix null pointer exception with some bad documents.
Intrinsic transcoding table generation utility added.
UNIX build: Now generates object files in platform-specific directories
Fix GCC build problem: Changed XML_GNUG to XML_GCC

Fixed #54. Changed self-assignment to now use the parameter value.
Reported by Helmut Eiken <H.Eiken@cli.de>
Fix bug # 19, add const keyword to API. As a result, update test case.
DOM: "specified" flag of attributes now set correctly.

Some fixes for content models that have multiple, trailing, empty
PE refs (for content model extension.)

First cut for additions to Win32 xcode. Based very loosely on a
prototype from Eric Ulevik.

Fixed a bug in SimpleContentModel that allowed an <a/> to be taken
as valid for a content model of (a,b).

Added a scanReset()/parseReset() method to the scanner and
parsers, to allow for reset after early exit from a progressive parse.
Added calls to new Terminate() call to all of the samples. Improved
documentation in SAX and DOM parsers.

Change "XML4C" to "Xerces" in many places
Add a cleanup method to XMLPlatformUtils.
Implement the Locator scheme for SAX.
Add a -n option to most of the samples, to enable namespaces
Fix an error where XMLScanner::parseNext() was falling through on an
exception instead of return a failure.
Implement the specialized string loading for Win98, since LoadStringW()
doesn't work on 98 and makes the loaded error text from the Win32
message loader come out junk
fix error when two trailing entity references in a content model, like so:
<!ELEMENT foo (a|b|c|d|e %one;%two;)*>
XMLCh defaults to wchar_t on platforms where wchar_t uses Unicode.
Add Windows-1252 as a built in encoding
Fixed an infinite loop caused while trying to trim leading white space from the raw URL during parsing.
Updates for EBCDIC code page issues.
Disallow EBCDIC documents without an encoding declaration

Fixed defect in compare[N]IString function. Defect and fix reported
by Bill Schindler from developer@bitranch.com
Fixed bug: xmlns:xxx="" should affect the mapping of the prefixes of sibling attributes
Don't weave base and relative paths unless relative part is really relative.
Win32 mutex implementation was changed to use critical sections for speed.

The API is not in place to allow client code to make sense of start/end entity
ref calls from attribute values. So suppress them for now.

Fixed bug: If an entity ends on the last > of some markup, then the end of entity
won't be sent because the end of entity is not sensed.
Fixes a bogus error about ]]> in char data.
Exposed the APIs to get to the byte offset in the source XML buffer.
Added a check for a broken pipe error on file read.
Update to support new ICU 1.4 release
Remove dependence on old utils standard streams
Added a NetAccessorException for use by implementations of the NetAccessor abstraction, if they need to report errors during processing
get the C++ and Java versions of error messages more into sync.
Moved the input source classes from / to framework/.
Changes to deal with multiply nested, relative paths, entities

ul.li: Improved error recovery and clarified error messages.
Released &XercesCName; after incorporating ICU as a value-added plug-in.
Has bug fixes, better conformance, better speed and cleaner internal architecture
Three additional samples added: PParse, StdInParse and EnumVal
Loadable message text enabling future translations to be easily plugged-in
Reorganized the util directory to better manage different platforms and compilers
Created initial code base derived from IBM's XML4C Version 2.0
Modified documentation to reflect new name (Xerces-C)
